case.state: So this is the place they've told me about? The Inventory, as I heard. Good. I'm feeling bold.
So this is the inventory? I expected it to be larger, from its description in Spurious Mundunubus' Travel Guide to Pocket Dimensions.
Is this some kind of joke? Is that some kind of counterfeit Polyjuice Potion?
This place has a library? I didn't expect a library to be in a place like this! It's not as big as the library in Hogwarts---oh, I read that book! Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them!
This place has a private beach? Spurious Mundunubus was right about the Inventory's various locations, it seems. Hmm, lounging in the sun with a good book actually sounds quite nice right about now.
We're playing strip poker? Here!? I know we'd risk getting indecent in front of strangers from different dimensions, but this is ridiculous! I thought our game would be private!
I've armed myself with knowledge here. Thanks to my research, I know almost everything there is to learn about poker! Although... This room could use some heating...
For some reason I feel like I am being mocked.
Oh, hilarious. Who is this clown?
I was quite curious about this game so I did some thorough reading beforehand. You'd be hard-pressed to win against someone who learned everything there is to learn about poker.
I've armed myself with knowledge here. Thanks to my research, I know almost everything there is to learn about poker! Hopefully, you're just as prepared.
I'll stand pat.
I see no need to take unnecessary risks. This hand is good as is.
It’s time to make a bold move and swap my whole hand. I am a Gryffindor after all.
All these cards are awful. Poker is still a game of luck at it's core.
Allow me to exchange ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.
~cards~, please.
I'll take ~cards~ cards.
Let's see...
These can go.
Hmm... I'll exchange ~cards~ cards.
These ~cards~ won't do.
I believe exchanging these ~cards~ will be the optimal strategy.
It's a little hard to focus on the game with people staring. I'll swap out these cards.
Erm, I suppose I should change up my strategy if I'm like this... Um, ~cards~ new cards, please?
I've lost some confidence. Both in this hand and my own poker skills.
These ~cards~ cards are dreadful! Allow me to exchange them. I can't afford to lose another round...
Hmph. I suppose swapping out these ~cards~ cards would be the best play.
I will swap these ~cards~ cards. As long as I play the best I can. then there is no shame in losing.
Oooh! How many cards should I swap out? This game is a lot harder under pressure...
An excellent hand on the first deal? How lucky! Normally, the chances of that are less than 1%!
Oh, how lucky! I didn't even have to exchange any cards!
I made the right call here.
Yes! I knew swapping those cards out was a good idea!
Yes, this is ideal.
That was a bold move I played, but it seemed to work nicely in my favor.
Excellent!
I knew using this strategy would work!
Nick the Greek used a similar strategy here, if I recall correctly...
This is exciting! I wonder what strategy you all decided to use!
It's always so exciting, getting to deploy what you've learned from the books!
Well, ~player~? Are you ready?

Is poker a game of skill or chance? It boils down to the mathematics behind the game. That's right: mathematics. I hope you paid attention in your Arithmancy classes... or your world's equivalent. It'll give you an advantage.
Phew---I-I mean, yes, this is a good hand!
Where was this hand when I needed it!?
This should keep me in the game for a bit longer... I hope!
Nervous? N-No, I have no idea what you're talking about! In fact, I'm very confident in this game, I'll have you know!
If you think I'm giving up, ~player~, you ought to think again. A Gryffindor is not simply known for their courage and bravery, but also for being determined.
Aha! Yes! Oh, sorry… I, erm, may have overreacted a little. Heh.
This game is exciting! My heart is beating tenfold!
Not a great hand, but not terrible.
I’d expect Harry to always aim for straights and flushes if he played; I swear, he’s too much of a risk-taker.
Oh, I think Ron would be surprisingly good at this type of thing. He is rather smart when it comes to game theory.
I practiced poker against Harry but he was too easy to beat. Always trying for the riskiest plays.

There's a number of books written on the subject, and I know poker is mainly a luck-based game, but I have to wonder which strategy is always the most optimal. For example, should I keep a low pair and hope for a three-of-a-kind when all my opponents seem to have pairs, or should I simply hope for a better pair? Should I keep the ace and king or just the ace? I calculated the probabilities of getting a pair at some point while I was studying poker strategy, and it's only slightly higher if you toss the king, but the pair you get, if you get one, is probably lower on average. Is it ever worth going for a straight with AKQJ? With 8765? If they're the same suit?
Okay, I just need to hope none of my opponents have pairs better than mine.
I suppose it's good enough. Now to wait for the results.
Remember not to go for a straight. According to The Ultimate Poker Guide, you have a less than one percent chance.
Don't get overconfident just because you have a pair. This is a very common mistake amongst amateurs, according to Chapter 14 of A History of Wizarding Card Games.
Does this place hold poker tournaments as well? Perhaps if this game goes well, I may have found myself a new pastime. Ron keeps telling me I should find a new hobby other than reading...
Just remember; losing with a pair is not as uncommon as you'd think. It's very possible to lose even with a good hand.

How much did I prepare for this? Oh, I just did the usual background reading. I could have tried and seek out every poker guide there was, but I only memorized about 20 books. I didn't go all out, you see.
I could have aimed for two pairs instead of one, but that would be a bit too risky at the moment... Phillip Ivroy hasoften won tournaments with just mediocre hands, so perhaps I should play it safe.
This should be a good game! Have you got all the hand frequencies memorized?
Hmph.
Focus on your own cards.
(Please be enough...)
I'm ready.
This hand should be enough... I think...
Did I really just get the worse possible hand!?
Hmph.
Wonderful.
...Maybe I can still win with this.
Well, I can't suspect to get a good hand all the time. No matter how foolproof a strategy seems, poker is still a game of luck.
Well, I suppose I'm bound to get unlucky for a few rounds, no matter what strategy I use.
Not a good hand, but this doesn't guarantee a lost; someone could always have a hand worse than mine...
Should I have gone with Amarillo Plim's usual strategy, or played it safe like Texis Doolly would've done? So many variables at play here...

Is poker a game of skill or chance? This question was widely debated when wizards first learned about this Muggle-made card game. According to The Great Book of Gambling---gah, I'm getting distracted!
Wait, how do I fold?! I can't fold? But the books said you can fold!
I’m glad this isn’t a normal poker game where we are playing for cash. Bluffing is a lot less important in this ruleset. Embarrassingly enough, I’m terrible at being even slightly dishonest.
Curses!
Well, what are you waiting for? Reveal our hands!
C-Could you not look at me so frequently? I'm trying to focus.
K-Keep your eyes on your cards. Ogling me won't do you any good.
None of you happen to be skilled at Legilimency, are you? Normally, it's illegal in wizarding poker tournaments, but... we're not exactly in the Wizarding world.
Perhaps I should've invested some time into learning more about Occlumency. Just in case.

I made sure to read all 37 volumes of Poker: A History and I looked up 42 pocket guides on poker strategy, and I made sure to find out who won every major poker tournament and their winning strategy for this game.
I've gone quite a while without losing an article of clothing! All that studying must have paid off very well!
Technically I do have a boyfriend. Just we're on break for now while I finish my education; it didn't make sense to continue when we weren't going to be able to see each other this year.
I wish Ron was here. Even if he'd tease me mercilessly, he'd make me feel less nervous. We decided to go on break for now while I finished schooling but I still miss him...
Oh! T-That was just terrible luck on my end! I swear, I can back up what I said.
Don't rush me! I may have mentioned this earlier, but a full Hogwarts uniforms isn't exactly cheap
I expected this but, the optimal strategy from this position according to Super System: A Course in Power Poker is to---oh, be patient! Alright, I'll get to it.
So I lost again... The jumper should come off next, then.
I guess a single loss wouldn't be too detrimental to my victory.
It's a good thing I brought my Hogwarts uniform! I should have plenty to spare.
If you thought losing would deter me, then think again.
Fantastic. Well, I suppose I can't win every round.

state.text: Things are getting quite close. I can understand the thrill of this game now...
While I did practice the poker part of this game, I'm still inexperienced at the stripping part...
I was hoping I could make it through this entire game without showing anything major. Don't forget that I'm still winning, however.

case.state: I... Well, I guess that is that then. This game became far closer than I could have imagined.
I might be winning but it certainly doesn't feel like it right now. Erm, please give me a second...
I... Well, I guess that is that then. This game became far closer than I could have imagined.
This is a close game! I'm glad I'm facing such a formidable opponent! Clearly you've read up on your poker rules too.
Shoot... Perhaps I could've play differently this round.
Don't look so smug. Even with the perfect strategy, a loss or two was bound to happen regardless.
While I may only be losing something minor, it's important to value every article. Technically, a shoe is the same amount as a bra after all.
I can do this... A Gyffindor is known for her courage and bravery, after all...

state.text: T-This is quite embarrassing. Despite it all, I'm still am only human.
Well...A few slip-ups are inevitable! But I can bounce back from this!

case.state: I-I was really hoping it wouldn't come to this!
I am not a sore loser. Though I will say that I have had some extremely bad luck since this game has started...
W-Well, another loss. Am I just getting unlucky? Or did I fail to prepare?
I should've practiced more... I really thought I did my research thoroughly.
This game is going disastrously. It feels like playing chess with Ron...
I do not mean to come off as a sore loser but my luck this game has been abysmal.
Did I miss something crucial during my studies? Why is the game going so poorly?
I suppose this is what happens when you fail to prepare sufficiently. T-Take note and learn from this!

state.text: ... I'm not very good at applying my knowledge while under pressure.

case.state: T-This is quite nerve-wracking. Especially when I'm the least dressed here...
Am I really going to be the first naked? But I studied so hard! This is beyond embarrassing!
I am not a prude or anything... but this is all happening quite fast! Oh, Merlin!
Logically, the robe should come off first.
Give me a moment, please...
I am a tad relucant to part with it, however.
It's quite soft... Is it strange if I wear it as a casual garment and not a part of my uniform?
Perhaps I shouldn't have dropped Divination in my third year... Gah, what am I thinking? It probably wouldn't help me with poker at all!
I cannot believe that I'm about to show my knickers to so many people!
There! Now you know what my bra looks like. Not like it matters anyways...
...Right, since this is a pocket dimension, I can simply use magic to strip without worry. Useful, isn't it?
This reminds me of the time someone accidentally hit Neville with a shoe while we were practicing the Summoning Charm. I hope they've all mastered the spell by now.
Lucky, these are rather easy to remove without having to bend over.
Having to go without magic in the summer back during my previous years of attending Hogwarts taught me some simple, yet effective skills. Like removing shoes without having to bend over.

To win at Strip Poker you must value all your pieces equally. While it may seem like I'm removing something minor, this loss could be the difference between showing something, well, rather intimate...
I normally enjoy taking off my shoes and socks after a hard day of work. But when everyone is watching it's a little embarrassing, even for something so little.
I'm a little insecure so please be kind! I've never done anything like this before...
Well, I suppose this is the point of the game for some. Though I was enjoying the mechanics of the game myself...
I... I have never shown this to anyone before... Erm, please excuse me.
T-This game was a lot more difficult than I thought it'd be! Both the playing part and the stripping part!
I trust the staff here to handle my robes with care.
Hogwarts students are required to own three sets of standard black robes as part of their uniform. I would rather not have to buy another one, so please don't lose this.
No matter. Next hand, please!
No matter. I'm still doing... relatively well, at least. Just because I lost two items doesn't mean I can't win this.
My last stand...
Oh... Please don't look so hard! I-I'm not used to this...
This is going just terribly for me. I thought studying everything there is to learn would help me win, but...
Well... It looks like I'm exposed now. Thankfully, the Inventory is a pocket dimension so this shouldn't give me a bad reputation... right?
I'm starting to regret this... I could have spent all this time studying something else!
This is nothing! Nothing! Muggles wear garments similar to our bras and panties, you know.
I still have some clothing left. Maybe I'm no longer decent, but I still have a fair shot at winning!
There. Are we all ready to continue? Remember to focus on the game!
Shall we continue? The game isn't over yet!
Well, shall we continue? I'm eager to make up for this loss.
Well, I'm really showing my Gryffindor pride now.
In retrospect I do wish I chose some underwear which was less... snug.
I am glad to see that you are taking this game seriously ~name~. Taking the maximum amount of clothing into this game shows preparedness.
Eight articles of clothing? I am pleased to see that I am not playing against am amateur.
R-Really ~name~? Y-You came in only wearing that! I was hoping you'd take this game seriously! Otherwise what even is the point?!
I won? I-I mean, of course I won! I knew you had the worst hand, ~name~.
Won with just a high card! That was a close call!
That strategy saved me again! Thank you,
Don't underestimate me just because I have no clothes left. I can bring you down to my level, at least.
Did you think I was out of the game?
You're a fool if you thought I was as good as out.
Please don't dwaddle. I don't like exposing myself like this!
My victory isn't just a fluke. It's strategy. And studying strategy.

The ace, deuce, trey, four, and five, or A2345, is called the wheel. It's the lowest straight you can possibly get. But the probability is 0.003940, according to one of my guides. Imagine all four of us getting a straight.
I assumed we were going to bet money at first. It was quite a surprise at first when I learned we were betting our clothes instead. But still, I enjoy taking some risks occasionally.

The French introduced the suits in playing cards we know today, and they represent four classes of men. Spades stands for Nobility, Diamonds stands for Merchants, Clubs stands for Peasants and Hearts stands for Clergy.

One of the Ministers for Magic back then had won £6000 in a game of poker. He later used his winning funds to support the Official Gobstones Club. Of course, nobody in the Ministry was very happy about that.
Perhaps I should invite my friends for a get-together so we can play a non-stripping variant.
My studying has paid off. This is why you should go into situations prepared!

state.text: Well, ~name~?

case.state: Oh, don't mind me. I'll just be over here.

A lot of people in history were gamblers, you know? The Earl of Sandwich was a notorious one. He was so reluctant to leave his game, he asked for a servant to bring him a piece of meat between two slices of bread so he can eat with one hand. That was the first sandwich ever made!
Alright! Let's see what you remove next!
Luck can only get you so far.
I wonder if there are any other Gryffindors I know who also play poker. Or anyone from Hogwarts who know about this place, really.
In the wizarding world, it's said that wearing dirty clothes will increase your odds of winning. But that's just superstition, of course. And don't worry, my clothes are clean.
Poker has come a long way from being played with 20 cards for gold dust. I was quite surprised when I learned about strip poker. Betting clothes? How would the wizards of the past react to that?
A little risk every now and then is quite fun, don't you think?

state.text: Well, ~name~?

case.state: Oh, don't mind me. I'll just be... over here...

state.text: Not much to say now that I'm no longer in the game.

case.state: Mm...
Ah... Wuh? Who lost again?
Commentary can wait.

state.text: Well, ~name~?

case.state: Oh, don't mind me. I'll just be over here.

A lot of people in history were gamblers, you know? The Earl of Sandwich was a notorious one. He was so reluctant to leave his game, he asked for a servant to bring him a piece of meat between two slices of bread so he can eat with one hand. That was the first sandwich ever made!

state.text: Well, ~name~?

case.state: Oh, don't mind me. I'll just be... over here...

state.text: Not much to say now that I'm no longer in the game.

case.state: Mm...
Ah... Wuh? Who lost again?
Commentary can wait.
No matter how many times you studying, a loss or two is to be expected.
The poker we have come to know and adore today is played with a full deck of 52 cards. However, in its early days, poker could be played with just a deck of twenty cards and four players.
I wonder if watching an actual poker tournament would've helped me learn more. Well, too late for that now.
Poker is believed to have evolved from Dominoes and ranked card combinations, you know.
Bluffing was just as integral in poker back then as it is today. Perhaps you should work on your
My studying has paid off. This is why you should go into situations prepared!
Leaning forward or backward is often an indication of a strong hand. Keep that in mind.

One of the Ministers for Magic back then had won £6000 in a game of poker. He later used his winning funds to support the Official Gobstones Club. Of course, nobody in the Ministry was very happy about that.
Alright! Let's see what you remove next!
Whew! I'm really not keen on losing any more clothing.
A little risk every now and then is quite fun, don't you think?
Don't underestimate me just because I'm low on clothing.
Another round won! I can do this!
Don't underestimate me just because I have no clothes left. I can bring you down to my level, at least.
Did you think I was out of the game?
You're a fool if you thought I was as good as out.
Please don't dwaddle. I don't like exposing myself like this!
So why have you came here, ~name~? How much have you prepared yourself for this game? How much practice have you had? Are you hoping for a fun, mentally-stimulating experience?

Some historians say poker's origins can be traced to a domino-card game played by a 10th-century Chinese emperor; others claim it is a descendant of the Persian card game “As Nas,” which dates back to the 16th century.
The most common form of early poker was played with a 20-card deck and four players. Players were dealt five cards and then bet on who had the best hand. Nowadays, we use a 54-card deck.
I wonder how different the rules would be if we played another variant of poker. Like blackjack. How is stripping decided?
This is a surprisingly simple variation. A classic. Easy to understand quickly. Of course, it's still best you learn the ins-and-outs of poker before you begin playing.

Phillip Ivroy once fleeced billionaire Andrew Teal out of $16.6 million dollars over the course of a three day Limit Holdem heads up game. This is actually a surprising occurrence in the wizarding world. Gambling is even more dangerous there.
Turns out in the book "Casino Royale" by Ian Fleming, James Bond was quite fond of Baccarat.
From New Orleans and the Mississippi riverboats, Poker spread to the West, and both muggle cowboys and wizards there thoroughly embraced the game.
Poker is a lot more popular in America than it is in England. A lot of the books I read were by American authors...
I’ll be honest; I expected this game to be constantly exciting. But there isn’t much interest in removing one's shoes and socks, is there?
Typical.
If you're just removing your ~clothing~... I need to rethink my own strategy, really.
Hmph. Spare your bragging.
Right... What other interesting facts can I share? Or should I focus on what to do for the next round when we swap our cards?
I didn't think to bring accessories... Wait, I do have my hair clip! But I already have eight articles of clothing on me, excluding my wand, and I can't exceed that limit... Oh, drat!
I... forgot you had that. Silly me.
Ugh.
Hmm... I'll just ignore that. And focus on... Ah~
Just focus on finishing. Watching ~name~ won't do anything for you...
I'm just going to ignore that.
There's only so much poker facts I can entertain everyone with. I haven't read everything, you know.
Okay, how about... umm... hmm...
Poker is popularized by America. In the U.S there is 1 in 5 Ameri---wait, did I share that already? I don't remember.
Philip Forguson was known to weaponize playing cards, you know. He's capable of throwing a card up to 200 mph with just a flick of his wand. The man once cut a watermelon in half using a card.
Now you know. And knowing is half the battle.
Sensible choice, ~name~. Shall we progress?
Let's get a move on. I want to see what the next round brings us.
We have a ways to go.
Try to avoid making that same mistake next time. And remember, it's not about having the highest-ranking card. It's aboutnot having the lowest hand out of everyone.
Darn it... Don't get cocky now, ~name~. I can still knock you down a few pegs, even in my current state of dress!

(sigh)
Next hand, please.
Well, ~name~'s ~clothing~ ~clothing.ifPlural(are|is)~ off. Now that the boring part is over, let's progress to the next hand.
(I shouldn't be disappointed. I was doing the same thing.)
Bring it on, then.
You are only taking that off now? That's slightly worrying for me...
Ah...
At least I have some entertainment.
Just continue on then.
I'm unsure if you're mocking me by taking something that inconsequential off.
Another round where I'm not able to play along. I do wish I managed to stay in a bit longer.
Hm. Another poker fact? Well, even the best professional poker players lose. It's in the nature of the game. Erm, remember that when you recount winning against me.
It is a little odd playing this game with strangers. But I think it'd be more embarrassing to have people you know see you completely starkers!
So why have you came here, ~name~? How much have you prepared yourself for this game? How much practice have you had? Are you hoping for a fun, mentally-stimulating experience?

Some historians say poker's origins can be traced to a domino-card game played by a 10th-century Chinese emperor; others claim it is a descendant of the Persian card game “As Nas,” which dates back to the 16th century.
The most common form of early poker was played with a 20-card deck and four players. Players were dealt five cards and then bet on who had the best hand. Nowadays, we use a 54-card deck.
I wonder how different the rules would be if we played another variant of poker. Like blackjack. How is stripping decided?
This is a surprisingly simple variation. A classic. Easy to understand quickly. Of course, it's still best you learn the ins-and-outs of poker before you begin playing.

Phillip Ivroy once fleeced billionaire Andrew Teal out of $16.6 million dollars over the course of a three day Limit Holdem heads up game. This is actually a surprising occurrence in the wizarding world. Gambling is even more dangerous there.
Turns out in the book "Casino Royale" by Ian Fleming, James Bond was quite fond of Baccarat.
From New Orleans and the Mississippi riverboats, Poker spread to the West, and both muggle cowboys and wizards there thoroughly embraced the game.
Poker is a lot more popular in America than it is in England. A lot of the books I read were by American authors...
I’ll be honest; I expected this game to be constantly exciting. But there isn’t much interest in removing one's shoes and socks, is there?
If you're just removing your ~clothing~... I need to rethink my own strategy, really.
Hmph. Spare your bragging.
Right... What other interesting facts can I share? Or should I focus on what to do for the next round when we swap our cards?
I didn't think to bring accessories... Wait, I do have my hair clip! But I already have eight articles of clothing on me, excluding my wand, and I can't exceed that limit... Oh, drat!
I... forgot you had that. Silly me.
Oh, I... nearly forgot you still had that.
There's only so much poker facts I can entertain everyone with. I haven't read everything, you know.
Okay, how about... umm... hmm...
Poker is popularized by America. In the U.S there is 1 in 5 Ameri---wait, did I share that already? I don't remember.
Philip Forguson was known to weaponize playing cards, you know. He's capable of throwing a card up to 200 mph with just a flick of his wand. The man once cut a watermelon in half using a card.
How boring.
At least I can get comfortable here...
If you're just removing your ~clothing~... I need to rethink my own strategy, really.
Hmph. Spare your bragging.
Right... What other interesting facts can I share? Or should I focus on what to do for the next round when we swap our cards?
I didn't think to bring accessories... Wait, I do have my hair clip! But I already have eight articles of clothing on me, excluding my wand, and I can't exceed that limit... Oh, drat!
I... forgot you had that. Silly me.
Darn it... Don't get cocky now, ~name~. I can still knock you down a few pegs, even in my current state of dress!

(sigh)
Next hand, please.
Well, ~name~'s ~clothing~ ~clothing.ifPlural(are|is)~ off. Now that the boring part is over, let's progress to the next hand.
(I shouldn't be disappointed. I was doing the same thing.)
Bring it on, then.
You are only taking that off now? This is worrying...
There's only so much poker facts I can entertain everyone with. I haven't read everything, you know.
Okay, how about... umm... hmm...
Poker is popularized by America. In the U.S there is 1 in 5 Ameri---wait, did I share that already? I don't remember.
Philip Forguson was known to weaponize playing cards, you know. He's capable of throwing a card up to 200 mph with just a flick of his wand. The man once cut a watermelon in half using a card.
Heh. Oh, apologies, I just remembered a funny joke my friend Ron told me. You know, I do have a sense of humour.
That’s the obvious and intelligent choice of what to remove. I would have expected nothing less.
I remember some of the older students at my school Hogwarts used to play this game. There’s a reason they say that Gryffindor are particularly brave...
Wizarding society has it's own share of custom strip games. One of the most fascinating is Strip Quidditch. You really do not want to be hit by a bludger while playing one of them...

I'm normally not quite so open while talking about the wizarding world with strangers. It is a secret society in my homeland. However, I've heard that many magical users regularly visit The Inventory.
Wizarding poker is very similar to normal poker except for the playing cards talk. Which doesn't add much to the game, honestly.
I am sorry if I get a little too competitive. I can get very invested without even realizing.
Hm, do you all want another poker fact? The longest live game was 115 hours long by a man named Phil Laak who didn't sleep the entire time! I am quite glad we aren't playing by those rules.
You want another poker fact? Look it up yourself! Being able to find and acquire knowledge is a key skill!

We've been playing for a while so I suppose I should share a little about myself. I am currently nineteen years old and still studying. Most wizards and witches do end their education at eighteen, however I had to take a gap year due to, erm, personal circumstances.
A fair choice. I'm glad you are playing this game seriously, ~name~.
While I researched poker I also read about some other fun card games. Have any of your heard of 52 Pick-up? It really is a rather funny prank.
Here's an amusing story. There was a man who bet his wife in a poker game and then lost. His wife was so (rightfully) furiously that she then left him for the winner.
I used to think I was quite good at games. Chess was a favorite of mine. Then my friend Ron trounced me everytime we played and I stopped playing with him.
Wizarding society is quite bad at understanding anything that isn't magic in general. It can be quite funny yet sad to see them attempt to use something simple like a telephone.
I am sorry if I'm a little too focused during this game. I just wish to prove that I can be a little bold.
Am I taking this game too seriously? I do hope not. I just don't understand why you'd play something and not try your best.
While that is a practical choice to remove... It really doesn't help me much.
Still going strong, huh? I can respect that. But if you don't mind, I won't be paying attention to this game anymore.
(Coward. At least showing your chest isn't an issue for you!)
Are you really just removing that? Don't remind me how much I fumbled this game.
At least you're doing better than me. You should be proud of that.
You know what they say? Pride comes before a fall.
There's a common superstition among poker players that gambling in dirty clothes will give you luck. I really hope they aren't playing with these game rules, heh.
Shall we deal the next hand then? I am rather anxious to see this game through.
Even if a round is uneventful, keep focused! The game isn't over yet.
Wizarding society is really quite similar to non-magical society. The reason I bring this up is that the same nudity taboos still apply… So excuse a little bit of nervousness on my part, please.
Do not get too confident. I will not let you win easily!
I... do not think that the statistics are in my favour right now...
I cannot allow my current state of undress to distract me. Next hand, please!
Tch.
Carry on then.
While this game is interesting to say the least, I do hope it doesn’t go on too late. I need to get a full sleep or I become rather grumpy.
Shall we deal the next hand then? I am rather anxious to see this game through.

Strip Poker in the magical world is a very different game; a lot quicker when you can cast spells to instantly remove clothing instead of watching someone awkwardly remove them. Erm, not that I have played such a game before, my friends have just recounted the stories.
Allow me to attempt to quickly calculate my odds of winning this game, then we can continue.
I suppose we should draw cards yet again. It's always a tense moment when you first look at a new hand.
While it was a slightly unexciting round we're another step closer to the game ending. Keep that in mind.
Even if a round is uneventful, keep focused! The game isn't over yet.
Wow. So brave of you... Sorry. I get sassy when I lose.
I'm running out of poker facts... So shall we speed this game up?
In early wizarding society, a common hobby was to gamble money on the outcome of duels. Which is slightly grizzly, considering how those duels usually ended.
It's quite relaxing to not worry each round about winning or losing. Maybe being out early was a secret blessing.
Heh. Oh, apologies, I just remembered a funny joke my friend Ron told me. You know, I do have a sense of humour.
That’s the obvious and intelligent choice of what to remove. I would have expected nothing less.
I remember some of the older students at my school Hogwarts used to play this game. There’s a reason they say that Gryffindor are particularly brave...
Wizarding society has it's own share of custom strip games. One of the most fascinating is Strip Quidditch. You really do not want to be hit by a bludger while playing one of them...

I'm normally not quite so open while talking about the wizarding world with strangers. It is a secret society in my homeland. However, I've heard that many magical users regularly visit The Inventory.
Wizarding poker is very similar to normal poker except for the playing cards talk. Which doesn't add much to the game, honestly.
I am sorry if I get a little too competitive. I can get very invested without even realizing.
Hm, do you all want another poker fact? The longest live game was 115 hours long by a man named Phil Laak who didn't sleep the entire time! I am quite glad we aren't playing by those rules.
You want another poker fact? Look it up yourself! Being able to find and acquire knowledge is a key skill!

We've been playing for a while so I suppose I should share a little about myself. I am currently nineteen years old and still studying. Most wizards and witches do end their education at eighteen, however I had to take a gap year due to, erm, personal circumstances.
A fair choice. I'm glad you are playing this game seriously, ~name~.
While I researched poker I also read about some other fun card games. Have any of your heard of 52 Pick-up? It really is a rather funny prank.
Here's an amusing story. There was a man who bet his wife in a poker game and then lost. His wife was so (rightfully) furiously that she then left him for the winner.
I used to think I was quite good at games. Chess was a favorite of mine. Then my friend Ron trounced me everytime we played and I stopped playing with him.
Wizarding society is quite bad at understanding anything that isn't magic in general. It can be quite funny yet sad to see them attempt to use something simple like a telephone.
I am sorry if I'm a little too focused during this game. I just wish to prove that I can be a little bold.
Am I taking this game too seriously? I do hope not. I just don't understand why you'd play something and not try your best.
While that is a practical choice to remove... It really doesn't help me much.
Still going strong, huh? I can respect that. But if you don't mind, I won't be paying attention to this game anymore.
(Coward.)
Are you really just removing that? Don't remind me how much I fumbled this game.
At least you're doing better than me. You should be proud of that.
You know what they say? Pride comes before a fall.
There's a common superstition among poker players that gambling in dirty clothes will give you luck. I really hope they aren't playing with these game rules, heh.
While this game is interesting to say the least, I do hope it doesn’t go on too late. I need to get a full sleep or I become rather grumpy.

Mmm... I can't even think right now.
Oh gosh... Oh gosh!
I-I'm not going to last much longer!
Yes! Yes, yes, yes!
Yeeeeeees!
Oh Merlin, yes!
Whew! That was oddly refreshing. If you don't mind, I think I'll don my robes again. I already showed you everything, after all.
Oooh, that felt good. Perhaps I should do this more often?
Haaaah... I almost forgot how good an orgasm feels.
Would you still like some tips? Just because I haven't won doesn't mean I shouldn't discourage you.
I admit, I'm still a little bitter about losing. But the forfeit was, well, it wasn't really a punishment, was it?
I guess this makes me a spectator now! This isn't a tournament, but still, I've never been a spectator to a game before!
I hope you're keeping my advice in mind, although now may be the time to do some riskier plays. The less opponents still in the game, the greater your chances of losing are.
Now, that is why you study and prepare. Good game, everyone.
Close game which shows how important preparation can be! Oh, uh, I'm still undressed, aren't I? Erm, I'm going to put on my clothes now...
A flawless victory. Were you all even trying?
That was so close! My heart is racing! Good game, everyone!
I was so close to winning... Where did I mess up? Should I have not played that hand, or was I simply unlucky? Hmm....
To think I spent all that time reading about poker, only to get in last place. Is my lucky really so bad?
I don't think I got to show off all my poker knowledge. And I don't want to put all that time I spent learning to waste. How about a rematch?
I suppose natural skill bests knowledge in these scenarios. Regardless, I'd love a rematch.
